title: Strand 5 Leaving Certificate Ordinary Level Functions and Calculus
headline: This free online maths course covers the Strand 5 Ordinary Level Leaving Certificate on functions and calculus.
description: Are you looking to continue reviewing high-level maths subjects, all in one place? This course on functions and calculus will help any Ordinary Level pupil with their Project Maths in the Leaving Cert exams. It will also be helpful for anyone who needs a foundational understanding of basic calculus and the functions involved in those calculations. Functions and calculus make up much of the Ordinary Level Paper 1 of the Project Maths exam.
courseDescription:
Functions, in maths, are known as the rules that define the relationship between multiple variables. This course provides every important link between algebra and numbers. It also introduces pupils to applications of calculus in real life. Some such examples include calculating the voltage of something electric or the speed of something.

The use of differentiation to find the slope of a given tangent to a curve at a point is explained. This then leads on to the study of decreasing and increasing functions. Functions and differentiation are often used in real life as an aid to understanding rates of decrease and increase. Various rules of differentiation will also be reviewed.

For example, you will explore problems involving the maximum speed that can be reached by a car and look at the highest point that can be reached by a rocket or firework. Finally, the mathematical concept of numerical integration is investigated through the use of the Trapezoidal Rule to find areas under given curves. So whether you are preparing for your leaving certificate or simply looking to study high-level maths, this course is for you!

Start Course Now
